question:
Your friend has been offered a place on a course at the university where you studied. He/She would like your advice about finding a place to live. Write a letter to your friend. In your letter
-describe where you lived when you were a student at the university
-recommend the best way for him/her to look for accommodation
-warn him/her of mistakes students make when choosing accommodation
text: I was writing to say congratulations on getting admitted to the Computer Technical Support program at Seneca. I heard you are looking for accommodation and wanted to share some tips.
As a Seneca student, I lived in a one-bedroom apartment. It was located in Scarborough and was close to the university. It had a lot of grocery shops nearby which was convenient for me.

I wanted to provide some suggestions on where to look for housing. Firstly, check with the university whether they have a room in their hostel. Secondly, look for housing advertisements on local websites like Kijiji. There are probably your best options when looking for accommodation.

I wanted to remind you about students' bad decisions when choosing accommodation. First, try to find a place near the university, which can save you a lot of travel time. Also, ensure restaurants are nearby so you can have a meal when you are not in the mood to cook.
I hope all of this was helpful for you.
